Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Trade-mark \Trade"-mark`\, n. A peculiar distinguishing mark or device affixed by a manufacturer or a merchant to his goods, the exclusive right of using which is recognized by law. [1913 Webster]
trademark n 1: a distinctive characteristic or attribute [syn: {hallmark}, {earmark}, {stylemark}] 2: a formally registered symbol identifying the manufacturer or distributor of a product
